item.title: How does features extraction on images work? - Quora
item.description:
How does features extraction on images work? - Quora

There is no single answer for this question since there are many diverse set of methods to extract feature from an image. First, what is called feature? "a distinctive attribute or aspect of something." so the thing is to have some set of values for a particular instance that diverse that instance from the counterparts.

item.title: A Full Hardware Guide to Deep Learning
item.description:
A Full Hardware Guide to Deep Learning

Deep Learning is very computationally intensive, so you will need a fast CPU with many cores, right? Or is it maybe wasteful to buy a fast CPU? One of the worst things you can do when building a deep learning system is to waste money on hardware that is unnecessary.

item.title: Taking Humans out of the Deep Learning Loop - Ryan Adams, Harvard
item.description: Taking Humans out of the Deep Learning Loop - Ryan Adams, Harvard

item.title: What's Wrong with Deep Learning? | TechTalks.tv
item.description:
What's Wrong with Deep Learning? | TechTalks.tv

TechTalks.tv is making it super-easy to publish, search and learn from slide-based videos, all in order to share educational content on the web.

item.title: Numenta, The Bruce Lee of AI and Deep Learning
item.description:
Numenta, The Bruce Lee of AI and Deep Learning

Growing new connections in your brain is more essential to learning than strengthening established connections. You may know how to be a tax lawyer because you've spent years strengthening your old tax law connections, but these are utterly useless when you take up ballroom dancing to find yourself a mate.

item.title: Understanding Convolution in Deep Learning
item.description:
Understanding Convolution in Deep Learning

Convolution is probably the most important concept in deep learning right now. It was convolution and convolutional nets that catapulted deep learning to the forefront of almost any machine learning task there is. But what makes convolution so powerful? How does it work? In this blog post I will explain convolution and relate it to...

item.title: Hugo Larochelle
item.description:
Hugo Larochelle

Voici la liste des sujets traités durant le cours, semaine après semaine. À chaque semaine sont associés des capsules vidéo explicatives, un article obligatoire à lire ainsi que des lectures optionnelles suggérées. La colonne " Date" correspond à la date de la semaine durant laquelle vous devez avoir visionné les vidéos.

item.title: Deep Learning Adversarial Examples - Clarifying Misconceptions
item.description:
Deep Learning Adversarial Examples - Clarifying Misconceptions

Google scientist clarifies misconceptions and myths around Deep Learning Adversarial Examples, including: they do not occur in practice, Deep Learning is more vulnerable to them, they can be easily solved, and human brains make similar mistakes. By Ian Goodfellow (Google).

item.title: Introduction to Neural Machine Translation with GPUs (part 3)
item.description:
Introduction to Neural Machine Translation with GPUs (part 3)

Note: This is the final part of a detailed three-part series on machine translation with neural networks by Kyunghyun Cho. You may enjoy part 1 and part 2. In the previous post in this series, I introduced a simple encoder-decoder model for machine translation. This simple encoder-decoder model is excellent at English-French translation.
